result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwight Joseph Lanfair

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwight Joseph Lanfair appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Dwight Joseph Lanfair.  Prosecuting attorney Katherine Seelow for Samuel Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Return on Doctor's Report.  Defense challenges the report. Court sets this matter for Competency Hearing. Court verified availability of Dr. Goebel's appearance with the Forensic Unit.  Defendant ordered to appear in person for next hearing date. Case adjourned to Br. 36.  Competency Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 a.m.
LANFAIR Competency Report.  Received and Filed.  nk
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Dwight Joseph Lanfair appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Dwight Joseph Lanfair.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-30-2022
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dwight Joseph Lanfair in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Dwight Joseph Lanfair in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dwight Joseph Lanfair appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
